title: Growing Potatoes Through the Year | Produce Made Simple

subtasks: Monitoring weather conditions in springtime
Preparing for potato planting when soil dries and frost ends (mid-April)
Planting potatoes within four to six weeks of preparation
Managing irrigation during dry periods
Continuing operations through summertime
Initiating potato harvest around August 1st
Continuing harvest for two weeks
Wrapping up harvest by mid-October
Reducing activities in winter, focusing on maintenance
Winter equipment maintenance and checks for upcoming year
Addressing ongoing tasks year-round with available work throughout seasons

Plant potatoes within four to six weeks (start in mid-April, ongoing)
Irrigate crops as needed during dry periods
Continue regular farm activities in summertime
Start potato harvest around August 1st
Continue harvesting for two weeks (finish by mid-October)
Perform winter maintenance and equipment checks
